text: if you've been watching my videos for
quite some time or following my blog
then you probably know that I kinda love
India just a little bit but something
else that I love that you probably don't
know yet I'm gonna tell ya is fall I
love this time of year I especially love
fall in Canada
I love sweater weather I like not being
too hot or not too cold
I love the crisp fresh air and the
changing of the leaves and of course
Halloween the best holiday ever and then
you got pumpkins I love pumpkins I like
going and buying them and then I like
carving them I like eating the seeds I
like pumpkin pie I like pumpkin cake
pumpkin muffins but I especially love
pumpkin chai lattes I have perfected the
pumpkin chai latte from scratch
and I'm gonna share it with you sorry
Starbucks but you ain't got nothing on
this pumpkin latte to make the pumpkin
syrup you will need 1 cup of water 3
tablespoons of pumpkin puree 1/2 a cup
of sugar I use coconut sugar 1 teaspoon
of ground nutmeg 1 teaspoon of ground
cinnamon 1/2 a teaspoon of ground ginger
and 1/4 teaspoon of ground cloves heat
the water and sugar in a saucepan over
medium heat stirring until the sugar is
fully dissolved turn the heat down to
medium-low and stirring the rest of the
ingredients cook for about 7 minutes
during frequently because you don't want
the sugar to burn or ingredients to come
to a boil
take off heat and let it cool for 10
minutes before straining it while the
pumpkin syrup is cooling let's make the
chai one tablespoon of fennel or any
seed six green cardamom pods 12 cloves 1
cinnamon stick a quarter teaspoon of
fresh ginger thinly sliced a quarter
teaspoon of black peppercorns two bay
leaves seven cups of water 3 tablespoons
of black tea three tablespoons of honey
and 1 cup of milk you can use soy cow
milk almond whatever you prefer add
fennel cardamom clove cinnamon ginger
black peppercorns and bay leaves - the
seven cups of water in a pot bring
ingredients to a boil and simmer for
five minutes while stirring occasionally
add the loose tea milk and honey to the
pot and simmer for another two minutes
while stirring occasionally strain tea
using a thin mesh strainer pour your
chai into a cup and add as much syrup as
you would like I use one and a half
teaspoons then you can add some foam
milk to the top if you like foam and
voila you have your very own pumpkin
spiced chai latte from scratch I hope
you enjoy this recipe let me know what
you think in the comment box below and
don't forget to subscribe to my channel
if you haven't already because I put up
lots of fun videos travel vlogs travel
advice recipes gifts we have fun here
see you next time
